summary: Robert C. Morrison was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents available are payroll and certification reports that list Morrison's name, position, salary, and employment dates. He appears in payroll certifications from April 1978 to January 1979, indicating his employment spanned at least this period. The documents do not provide specific details about Morrison's role within the committee, but his presence on the payroll suggests he was involved in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Robert C. Morrison's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and impact of his role are not detailed in the provided documents.
